com.scalien.scaliendb
Class Table

java.lang.Object
  com.scalien.scaliendb.Table

public class Table
extends java.lang.Object

Table is a convenience class for encapsulating table related operations.

ScalienDB uses databases and tables to manage key value namespaces.

Example: 

 db = client.getDatabase("testDatabase");
 table = db.getTable("testTable");
 // some sets
 for (i = 0; i < 1000; i++) 
     table.set("foo" + i, "foo" + i);
 client.submit();
 for (i = 0; i < 1000; i++) 
     table.set("bar" + i, "bar" + i);
 client.submit()
 // some deletes
 table.delete("foo0");
 table.delete("foo10");
 client.submit();
 // count
 System.out.println("number of keys starting with foo: " + table.count(new StringRangeParams().prefix("foo")));
 // iterate
 for (KeyValue<String, String> kv : table.getKeyValueIterator(new StringRangeParams().prefix("bar")))
     System.out.println(kv.getKey() + " => " + kv.getValue());
 // truncate
 table.truncate();

See Also:
Database.createTable(String), Database.createTable(String, Quorum), Database.getTable(String), Database

getKeyIterator

public StringKeyIterator getKeyIterator(StringRangeParams ps)
                                 throws SDBPException
Return an iterator that will return only keys.

Parameters:
ps - The parameters of iteration, as a StringRangeParams.

Example: 

 db = client.getDatabase("testDatabase");
 table = db.getTable("testTable");
 for (String s : table.getKeyIterator(new StringRangeParams().prefix("foo")))
     System.out.println(s);
Returns:
The iterator.
Throws:
SDBPException
See Also:
StringRangeParams, getKeyIterator(ByteRangeParams), getKeyValueIterator(StringRangeParams), getKeyValueIterator(ByteRangeParams)

getKeyValueIterator

public StringKeyValueIterator getKeyValueIterator(StringRangeParams ps)
                                           throws SDBPException
Return an iterator that will return keys and values as a KeyValue<String, String>.

Parameters:
ps - The parameters of iteration, as a StringRangeParams.

Example: 

 db = client.getDatabase("testDatabase");
 table = db.getTable("testTable");
 for (KeyValue<String, String> kv in table.getKeyValueIterator(new StringRangeParams().prefix("foo")))
     System.out.println(kv.getKey() + " => " + kv.getValue());
Returns:
The iterator.
Throws:
SDBPException
See Also:
StringRangeParams, getKeyValueIterator(ByteRangeParams), getKeyIterator(StringRangeParams), getKeyIterator(ByteRangeParams)
